Package edu.uw.tcss.game.model

package edu.uw.tcss.game.model
Game model - Contains all game logic, state management, and business rules.

This package implements the Model component of the MVC pattern, maintaining complete separation from presentation concerns. The model is responsible for game state, move validation, and notifying observers of state changes.

Architecture and Design Patterns

Singleton Pattern

The Game class implements the Singleton pattern using double-checked locking to ensure thread-safe lazy initialization. This guarantees a single source of truth for game state throughout the application.

Observer Pattern (PropertyChangeListener)

The model uses Java's PropertyChangeListener framework to implement the Observer pattern. Instead of traditional string-based property names, this implementation uses type-safe sealed GameEvent types that can be pattern-matched for compile-time safety.

Immutable Data Transfer

All data objects (GameControls.Point, GameControls.ValidMoves, and all GameEvent subtypes) are implemented as immutable records, ensuring thread safety and preventing accidental state mutations.

Key Classes and Interfaces

Game
The core game model implementing Singleton and Observer patterns. Manages game state and coordinates all game operations.
GameControls
Defines the contract for game operations. Contains nested types for moves, positions, and valid move state.
PropertyChangeEnabledGameControls
Extends GameControls with PropertyChangeListener support for event-driven architecture.
GameEvent
Sealed interface defining type-safe game events. Permits exactly three implementations: MoveEvent, InvalidMoveEvent, and NewGameEvent.

Event Flow

// Listeners register for events
game.addPropertyChangeListener(event -> {
    // Pattern matching on sealed types
    switch (event.getNewValue()) {
        case GameEvent.MoveEvent e ->
            System.out.println("Moved to: " + e.newLocation());
        case GameEvent.InvalidMoveEvent e ->
            System.out.println("Invalid move: " + e.attemptedDirection());
        case GameEvent.NewGameEvent e ->
            System.out.println("New game started");
    }
});

// Game operations trigger events
game.moveRight();  // Fires MoveEvent or InvalidMoveEvent
game.newGame();    // Fires NewGameEvent

Modern Java Features

This package demonstrates several modern Java features:

  • Records (Java 16+) - Immutable data carriers for events and state
  • Sealed Classes (Java 17+) - Controlled type hierarchy for GameEvent
  • Pattern Matching (Java 21+) - Type-safe event handling in switch expressions
  • Default Methods - Intelligent defaults in GameEvent interface
Version:
Winter 2025
Author:
Charles Bryan

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    edu.uw.tcss.game
    TCSS 305 Game Application - Educational demonstration of modern Java design patterns.
  • Class
    Description
    Game
    The Game class simulates a simple game with a piece moving on a board.
    GameControls
    Defines mutable behaviors for a simple "game".
    GameControls.Move
    Constants describing the valid moves for a game piece.
    GameControls.Point
    Data class that represents a "point" on the game board.
    GameControls.ValidMoves
    Data class that represents the which moves are valid in the current state of the Game.
    GameEvent
    Sealed interface representing type-safe events for the game's PropertyChangeListener framework.
    GameEvent.InvalidMoveEvent
    Event fired when an invalid move is attempted.
    GameEvent.MoveEvent
    Event fired when a valid move is made in any direction.
    GameEvent.NewGameEvent
    Event fired when a new game is started.
    PropertyChangeEnabledGameControls
    Defines behaviors allowing PropertyChangeListeners to be added or removed from a GameContols object.
